summary.p: 2 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 42; Qurʾānic Text: Q 2:156-2:162; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 226 x 152mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
2 fol. 152×226 mm (1.5). Support: thin transparent parchment, hair side of yellowish color, flesh side almost white. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: bifolium from the middle of a quire, H1F / F2H.
Text layout: 80×155/160 мм (2.0), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: absent. Vocalization: large round red dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – teardrop-shaped medallions (type 4.1.1) in the text line, drawn with gold and colors, with the inscribed word اية ; for groups of ten verses – round medallions in the text line (type 2.A.II) in gold and colors, with the inscribed number of the verse (ماية ستون – fol. 2v).
Inscriptions: all the sheets have pencil marks with the surah numbers in Roman numerals and verse numbers in Arabic numerals.

Defects: large dark stain on the inner upper corner of fol. 1; traces of moisture along the spine; outer lower corner of margins damaged probably by rodents; minor damage of parchment by aggressive ink; ink peeling off on the flesh side of some pages.
Old accession numbers: B. 20 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–2v. Surah 2, verses 151(156) – 157(162). Incipit: [أصا]بتهم مصيبة . Explicit: : خالد[ين فيها] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
